NEET_Biology_Teacher_Note: Hello future doctors! The human heart is a high-yield topic in NEET. Focus on the cardiac cycle, heart sounds, and ECG interpretation. Understanding the conduction path (SA Node to Purkinje) is essential!

Student_Tips_on_Human_Heart.Tip_1: Pacemaker Priority: The SA node generates rhythmic impulses independently (auto-excitable).
Student_Tips_on_Human_Heart.Tip_2: Valvular Security: Valves strictly prevent backflow. Mitral = Left, Tricuspid = Right.
Student_Tips_on_Human_Heart.Tip_3: Pressure Dynamics: Lub sound is SV closure (Systole start), Dub is SLV closure (Diastole start).
Student_Tips_on_Human_Heart.Tip_4: ECG peaks: P (Atrial systole), QRS (Ventricular systole), T (Ventricular diastole).
Student_Tips_on_Human_Heart.Tip_5: Circulation Check: Double circulation means blood passes through the heart twice for one full circuit of the body.
